intro: Masdevallia isos, commonly known as the zigzag orchid, is a species native to the cloud forests of South America. It is characterized by its striking, often brightly colored flowers that are typically borne on slender, curved stems. The plant features elongated, narrow leaves that are usually arranged in a rosette pattern, aiding in water retention. Masdevallia isos thrives in cool, humid environments with indirect light, making it a popular choice for greenhouse cultivation. Its unique floral structure and ornamental value contribute to its appeal among orchid enthusiasts.
